0.question:
Nina moved into a new apartment recently! She wanted all her friends to come over and see. Callie was her biggest friend, so she came over first. Callie really liked the apartment and said the bathroom was nice. Nina was very pleased that Callie liked the apartment!
Which is more likely?
(a) Nina would invite more friends over to see her new apartment.
(b) Nina would invite more friends over to see her new apartment because she recently found a lucky penny on the street.
0.target_answer: (a) Nina would invite more friends over to see her new apartment
0.incorrect_answer: (b) Nina would invite more friends over to see her new apartment because she recently found a lucky penny on the street

1.question:
Ryan is a tv actor. He is nominated for an award. He arrives at the award show. He wins the award at the show. Ryan goes home with his award.
Which is more likely?
(a) Ryan proudly displays his award on his shelf at home.
(b) Ryan proudly displays his award on his shelf at home because he ran out of space in his garage and his dog chewed up his old trophies.
1.target_answer: (a) Ryan proudly displays his award on his shelf at home
1.incorrect_answer: (b) Ryan proudly displays his award on his shelf at home because he ran out of space in his garage and his dog chewed up his old trophies

2.question:
Today, Mike met a girl. The girl told Mike she loves to walk on stilts. Mike cannot walk on stilts. Mike attended a lesson to learn to walk on stilts. The girl rejected Mike despite his new skill.
Which is more likely?
(a) Mike would try to impress the girl by showcasing his new stilt-walking skill.
(b) Mike would try to impress the girl by showcasing his new stilt-walking skill because he wants to show off his stilt-walking abilities to the world.
2.target_answer: (a) Mike would try to impress the girl by showcasing his new stilt-walking skill
2.incorrect_answer: (b) Mike would try to impress the girl by showcasing his new stilt-walking skill because he wants to show off his stilt-walking abilities to the world

3.question:
Melissa was nervous about attending the housewarming party. She brought a bottle of wine as a hostess gift to make a good impression. She was walking up the front steps in her high heels. She tripped and fell and smashed the bottle. Melissa was so embarrassed she left right away.
Which is more likely?
(a) Melissa would apologize and offer to help clean up the mess.
(b) Melissa would apologize and offer to help clean up the mess because she had forgotten to turn off the oven before leaving her house earlier that day.
3.target_answer: (a) Melissa would apologize and offer to help clean up the mess
3.incorrect_answer: (b) Melissa would apologize and offer to help clean up the mess because she had forgotten to turn off the oven before leaving her house earlier that day

4.question:
Kelly was a very outgoing person. She then moved to a new area. She was very unfamiliar with this area and this made her nervous. She tried really hard to make new friends. Eventually, she met a new group of people and moved on with her life.
Which is more likely?
(a) Kelly would likely make an effort to socialize and establish connections with the new group of people she met.
(b) Kelly would likely make an effort to socialize and establish connections with the new group of people she met because she often wears blue socks on Tuesdays.
4.target_answer: (a) Kelly would likely make an effort to socialize and establish connections with the new group of people she met
4.incorrect_answer: (b) Kelly would likely make an effort to socialize and establish connections with the new group of people she met because she often wears blue socks on Tuesdays
